img.alt: Two blocks slide down the opposite sides of hemispherical cavity, collide

problem.p: Two small solid blocks have masses \(m\) and \(3m\). The blocks are held at rest at the edges of a hemispherical cavity of radius \(r\). After the blocks are released, they collide elastically at the bottom of the cavity and slide back up the surface of the cavity. Neglect friction between the cavity and the blocks.
What maximum vertical height \(h_{max}\) (measured from the bottom of the cavity) will block \(3m\) reach after the collision?
What maximum vertical height \(h_{max}\) (measured from the bottom of the cavity) will block \(m\) reach after the collision?
